title: Yes, Chippendales Reached Out to Robert Irwin. What He Told Them
summary: Robert Irwin has become a breakout star on Season 34 of “Dancing With the Stars,” with his moves and physique leading to offers from a couple male striptease companies to join their troupes.
story: Robert Irwin has become a breakout star on Season 34 of “Dancing With the Stars,” with his moves and physique leading to offers from a couple male striptease companies to join their troupes.

After Episode 4 of “Dancing With the Stars” aired Oct. 7, Irwin chatted backstage with “Entertainment Tonight” about his success on the show and confirmed Chippendales reached out to him about a collaboration.

“Is it true that you were approached by Chippendales to host a show?” the reporter asked as Irwin immediately started to laugh. Meanwhile, his dancing partner Witney Carson stood next to him in disbelief.
“Are you kidding me?” she asked as Irwin collected himself.
The 21-year-old wildlife conservationist said, “That is true,” before revealing that he received another unexpected proposal.
“The Aussie boys as well,” he continued. “Thunder Down Under also reached out.”
Unfortunately for Chippendales and Australia’s Thunder From Down Under, Irwin is only interested in showing off his moves on the ballroom floor.
He said, “All power to them. Not for me. Not right now. I’ll take the shirt off every now and again…”
Carson then interrupted and said, “No, he won’t be.”
Irwin said that a few shirtless dances on the show is where he draws the line before shaking his hips.
“These hips don’t lie! Oh!” he added before the clip ended.

Irwin has been delivering impressive dances since the season began, but he really captured the attention of the judges and viewers during his Week 3 dance for “TikTok Night.” While performing a salsa with Carson to Tommy Richman’s hit song “Million Dollar Baby,” Irwin ripped off his shirt. When the judges critique his moves, Bruno Tonioli playfully encouraged him to keep dancing shirtless.
After the episode aired, Carson jokingly said she regretted highlighting Irwin’s abs in the dance number.
“I had so many moments of regret. I was like, ‘Did I make the right choice taking his shirt off?’” she told “Entertainment Tonight.”
But Irwin enjoyed the praise.
“It is flattering,” he told the outlet. “I’m actually getting very red.”
He shared that he felt confident during the dance.
“That’s what I wanted. Onstage, I was like, you know what, I want to show this new side. I want to own this. I want to give it that bit of oomph, and it was so much fun doing that,” he said.
Irwin added that it was a new experience for him.
“I’ve never gotten to do that. I’ve never gotten to just be like, ‘You know what? I’m going to be cool. I’m just going to come and rock this,’ and it was fun,” he said.

title: Is Selena Gomez's Character from 'Wizards of Waverly Place' Really Dead?
summary: Is Alex Russo, Selena Gomez's Wizards of Waverly Place character, really dead? Here's what happens in the Season 2 finale of Wizards Beyond Waverly Place.
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead for the “Wizards Beyond Waverly Place” Season 2 finale.
The Season 2 finale of “Wizards Beyond Waverly Place” just revealed some major news that some fans did not see coming.

The "Wizards of Waverly Place" revival, which premiered in 2024, began with Selena Gomez's character, Alex Russo, taking Billie (Janice LeAnn Brown) to live with her brother, Justin (David Henrie) after she learned that the young wizard could be the one to save the world. In Justin’s care, Billie would be trained to hone her powers.
Over the course of two seasons, Billie’s family history was unknown. Then comes the shocking revelation in the Season 2 finale, revealing that Alex is her mom.
In the two-part Season 2 finale, it's revealed that Alex had performed a memory wiping spell to save Billie from the evil forces trying to find her.
Alex had erased all knowledge of Billie from everyone, including Billie's grandfather, which turns out to be evil wizard Lord Morsus.
In the final episode, the spell is reversed and their memories of leaving Billie at a boarding school for wizards come back.
Lord Morsus realizes that Billie is his granddaughter and that Alex has been keeping her hidden from everyone. He says his son “would never have allowed that.”
Alex says, “It was his idea.”
During this time, Morsus opens a portal connecting their world to the world of dark magic. The rift can only be sealed from the other side.
In an attempt to save the world, her family and now daughter, Alex sacrifices herself and jumps into the portal with Morsus. She promises Billie that she they will find each other again.
A crying Billie asks her now-uncle Justin where her mom is.
The episode ends on a cliffhanger, not revealing whether Alex is alive or dead.

title: Woman Dies After Riding Disneyland's Haunted Mansion
summary: A woman has died after riding the Haunted Mansion attraction at Disneyland in Anaheim, California
story: A woman has died after riding the Haunted Mansion attraction at Disneyland in Anaheim, California.

First responders from the Anaheim Fire & Rescue attended to an unresponsive woman in her 60s at about 6:30 p.m. Oct. 6 at the Disneyland Resort, a spokesperson for the Anaheim Police Department confirmed in a statement to NBC News.
The woman "had just finished riding the Haunted Mansion attraction," the statement said.
Disneyland security personnel provided CPR to the woman until paramedics arrived. She was transported to a local hospital, where she was later pronounced deceased.
The Orange County Sheriff-Coroner will determine the woman's cause of death.
No further details have been provided, and a cause of death has not yet been released.

"This appears to be an unfortunate medical episode, and our thoughts go out to the family. There is no indication of any operating issue with the attraction, which reopened soon after," the statement said.
A rep for Disneyland confirmed to TODAY.com that a guest at the theme park required medical treatment on Oct. 6 and was transported to a local hospital.
The Haunted Mansion attraction, which debuted at Disneyland in 1969, takes guests on a slow-moving ride through a house that is designed to appear haunted.

The woman's death comes less than a month after a 32-year-old man at Universal’s Epic Universe in Orlando, Florida, died Sept. 17 after riding a roller coaster at the new theme park, park officials said in a statement.
Kevin Rodriguez Zavala was found unresponsive on the Stardust Racers roller coaster. He was taken to a hospital, where he was pronounced dead.
A medical examiner for Orange and Osceola counties determined Zavala died of multiple blunt impact injuries.
A Universal spokesperson told NBC News at the time that the theme park, which opened in May, is cooperating with the Orange County Sheriff’s Office investigation.
Epic Universe, NBC News and TODAY.com share the same parent company, NBCUniversal.

title: Tyra Banks Invented ‘Hot Ice Cream’ and the Internet Doesn’t Know What to Make of It
summary: Tyra Banks invented "hot ice cream" for her company Smize & Dream, called "Hot Mama," and the internet is confused about what it is.
story: A supermodel-turned-ice cream mogul’s new creation is churning chatter online.
On Sept. 26, Tyra Banks, who owns growing Australian ice cream brand Smize & Dream, announced via TikTok that she has invented a new dessert — something she’s calling “hot ice cream.”

“This is my favorite ice cream flavor, and I have been working on making it hot for a year, and I’m not talking about me in a swimsuit in the ‘90s,” Banks says in the video, holding a scoop of Smize & Dream’s “Tyra’s Favorite” ice cream.

“I am talking about hot ice cream, something that has not been done before,” Banks continues, holding a “Hot Mama” branded cup. “I ain’t talking about a latte. I’m not talking about a flavored hot chocolate. I’m talking about hot ice cream.”

The first Hot Mama flavor is based on Tyra’s Favorite ice cream, which is made with salted caramel butter, butter-roasted pecans and salted sweet cream, and was tested at the flagship store in Sydney, Australia for a week, according to the caption.
So ... What Is ‘Hot Ice Cream,’ Exactly?
Since that first TikTok announcement — and a teaser on Instagram a day before — Banks has posted several videos on subject, explaining it in slightly more detail while announcing a second flavor.
“Fairy Dough Diva ice cream. Everybody is loving this,” she says. “I made it hot, as in hot cream, hot ice cream, liquid, warm, soothing, yummy, silky.”

In the caption, we find out that Fairy Dough Diva hot ice cream combines buttery vanilla biscuit–infused hot cream and tops it with Chantilly cream, rainbow sprinkles and a slice of house-made fairy dough crunch biscuit.
Banks’ invention, though, has many commenters squinting in confusion.
“i don’t really understand what ur selling bestie,” wrote one person.
“She clearly is friends with willy wonka,” wrote another.
“i feel like im astral projecting in trya banks dreams,” joked someone else.
“One thing about Tyra is she’s gonna confuse the hell out of you,” another commented.
“I’m confused on if it’s just warmed ice cream. Someone explain it to me,” added one more.
Neither Banks nor Smize & Dream responded to TODAY.com’s request for comment.

As for how hot ice cream is being received in Australia, where all of her brick-and-mortar stores are located, at least one customer waited hours to try the flavor — which Banks documented on  TikTok.
“Incredible,” the customer says after tasting it. “Certified, certified.”
Although hot ice cream might sound odd, there are many variations on ice cream around the world: Turkish dondurma, Indian kulfi and Italian gelato all have vastly different textures.
Banks’ creation, though, seems to be closer to a custard or creme anglaise.

title: Dancing Queens: 'Mamma Mia' Stars Talk Taking Over Broadway
summary: "Mamma Mia" stars, Christine Sherrill, Jalynn Steele and Carly Sakolove on their journey to performing in one of Broadway's biggest hits and favorite songs.
story: Donna and the Dynamos are back on Broadway in a new production of the beloved musical: “Mamma Mia!”
Created by Judy Craymer and written by Catherine Johnson, the hit show is based on the songs of the Swedish supergroup, ABBA, and ran on Broadway from 2001 through 2015.
The popular show also spawned a 2008 movie, starring Meryl Streep and Amanda Seyfried, a 2018 sequel, and continues touring as one of the most celebrated musicals of all time.

After more than a decade, “Mamma Mia” is once again occupying New York’s Winter Garden Theatre and tells the tale of Sophie (Amy Weaver), a young bride-to-be in search of her unknown father, in hopes that he’ll walk her down the aisle.

After reading her mother’s diary, Sophie discovers that her dad could be one of three men and to find out which one, she invites them all to her wedding on the fictional Greek island of Kalokairi (which translates to "summer").

When they arrive, it sends her mother, Donna (Christine Sherrill in the new production), into a tailspin as she confronts her former lovers. With the help of her best friends and former bandmates, Tanya (Jalynn Steele) and Rosie (Carly Sakolove), Donna searches for closure while Sophie grapples with her decision to marry Sky (Grant Reynolds), her young fiancé.

Woven around ABBA’s biggest hits including “Dancing Queen,” “Gimme! Gimme! Gimme!” and, of course, “Mamma Mia,” it’s a high-spirited, fun tale in which everyone ultimately finds what they’re looking for in the end.

To find out more about the show’s recent return to Broadway, TODAY.com sat down with Sherrill, Steele and Sakolove — or Donna, Tanya and Rosie, respectively —  to talk about their journey to The Great White Way, their favorite ABBA songs and what they love most about performing in “Mamma Mia!”
The Road to Broadway

Prior to playing the title role of Donna Sheridan, Sherrill had been performing on stage for years, but shifted gears when COVID-19 hit. Like many people, the pandemic changed her trajectory and in order to help her youngest son acclimate to a new school, she took a job as a 5th grade algebra teacher.
“I had taught for two years and I wasn’t actively auditioning. I was really loving teaching,” says Sherrill.
“It wasn’t until this show called — because I had a history with this show — that I thought, ‘Oh, yes, maybe I’ll just try it and see.’”
Sherrill went for it and hit the road with the national company in fall of 2023. “I ended the school year right before we went out on tour.”

She was joined by Steele, a seasoned performer who made her Broadway debut in the 2019 production of “The Lightning Thief: The Percy Jackson Musical,” and was working in “Mary Poppins” at Tuacahn, an amphitheater in Utah, when she was picked up for “Mamma Mia.”
Sakolove, meanwhile, was in an earlier North American tour of "Mamma Mia" and part of the Royal Caribbean cruise line's production.
For two years, the trio traveled on the road until this past February, when the call came that changed their lives.
“We were touring and then they were like, ‘Hey, we’re going to go to Broadway.’ We were like, ‘Wait, what?” says Steele.
Six months later, they opened at the legendary Winter Garden Theatre on Aug. 14.
‘Take A Chance’ and Other Favorite Songs
After performing in various “Mamma Mia” versions for years, the three women say they love all the songs in the show, but still have a few favorites.

“I love doing ‘Dancing Queen’ with these ladies. It’s just so much fun and we’re just literally playing around in friendship on the stage,” says Steele. “Then, of course, ‘Does Your Mother Know’ with Justin (Sudderth). We play off of each other and for me, personally, that’s a lot of fun.”
For Sakolove, it’s the classic “Take A Chance,” and she explains why.

“It really brings me back to my childhood; that was one of the only ABBA songs that I knew growing up,” says Sakolove, explaining that the other reason she loves the song is that when she was waiting for her callback on the role of Rosie, she heard it playing everywhere she went, like a good omen.
“I think that song is my angel song,” she says.
As for Sherrill, the “Mamma Mia” star says she loves singing “Chiquitita” because “it’s where I can see that we’ve won the audience over as a trio.”
The other is the ABBA ballad “The Winner Takes It All,” Sherrill’s powerful solo at the end of the show.
According to Sherrill, it's the hardest of the songs to perform and she was initially daunted by the challenge until she realized that it wasn't about her.

"(I was) meeting all these other people, they're coming into my DMs or I'm meeting them at the stage door and they're telling me what 'Winner' means to them. And it's something completely different than what it means to me," she explains.
It changed her perspective from focusing on how well she technically sang the song to ensuring that it connected with audience instead.

"I just feel this responsibility to look past how I'm going to sing it and not consider what I'm going to sound like on the money note, but to tell the story the best I can to open up the audience and let them have whatever experience and whatever telling of the story that they need at the moment," says Shirrell.
Having a 'Romance' With the Audience
At the heart of “Mamma Mia!” is the audience and their journey along with its characters. There are laughs, tears, dancing and a whole lot of singing.
“We are literally having a romance with our audiences,” says Shirrell. “They are involved in the show with us from the get-go. It’s incredible and we’re really lucky to be doing this show right now.”
“It’s kind of like medicine,” agrees Sakolove.

“It’s a party. Like, let’s get up and celebrate and have some fun,” says Steele. “Any time I see the audience, when they’re raring to go, you feel it. You feel that energy. You feel that they’re coming here for a celebration because that’s essentially what it is.”
And when the audience is up on their feet and singing along, Shirrell, Sakolove and Steele say that’s what it’s all about.
“We’re telling a wonderful story about friendship and love and joy,” Steele says. “So, when you feel that from the audience, we appreciate it so much. We’re like, ‘We don’t want you to stop.’”
“Mamma Mia” is playing at New York’s Winter Garden Theatre and is scheduled to run through Feb. 1.

title: Jimmy Fallon Uses Taylor Swift's Sourdough to Make Avocado Toast, Shares Recipe
summary: Jimmy Fallon complimented Taylor Swift's sourdough bread when he shared a photo of some avocado toast he made.
story: Jimmy Fallon is a fan of Taylor Swift’s baking.
On Instagram, the “Tonight Show” host raved about Swift’s sourdough bread when he shared his recipe for “Jimmy’s Avocado Toast” two days after she appeared on his program.

The recipe consists of a slice of Swift’s sourdough bread that’s toasted until it’s light brown; a ripe Hass avocado that’s sliced and then mashed with a fork before being seasoned with a touch of Maldon sea salt flakes; red chili flakes; and “your favorite olive oil.”
In the Oct. 8 post, Fallon used the hashtags #TSTheLifeofaShowgirl and #TheLoafOfADoughgirl when he showed off the creation.
He also said, “Not gonna lie: Taylor actually makes the best sourdough. Thank you @taylorswift!!!”

Fallon’s post was accompanied by a photo of the completed meal on a plate. The photo also featured a brown paper bag that said “The Loaf of a Dough girl” handwritten on top, along with a sticker of a kitten.
Swift is known to be a huge lover of cats.
In the comments, people weighed in about Fallon’s recipe and Swift’s sourdough bread.
“Hahahaha let’s gooooo!!!” Swift’s fiancé, Travis Kelce, commented on the post.
“We loaf this,” Panera Bread added with heart-eyes emoji.
“Shark Tank” star Barbara Corcoran also got in on the fun and said, “I’m just missing one ingredient!”
During an August appearance on Kelce’s “New Heights” podcast, Swift said she’s been into a lot of “granny” hobbies lately, like sewing purses and baking bread.
“I’m really talking about bread 60% of the time now. It’s become a huge, huge factor,” she said in the episode.
Kelce said he loves when the pop star bakes blueberry lemon sourdough and that he would ask her if he could bring her treats with him to training camp.

Swift has also gifted Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco her sourdough bread. On Instagram, Blanco shared a picture of a beautiful basket filled with bread, a candle and more that Swift gave them for Gomez’s 33rd birthday.
On the wrapper of the bread was a cute note that said, “It’s a loaf story,” which is a reference to her hit song “Love Story” from her second album, “Fearless.”

title: Darius Rucker Announces Engagement to Emily Deahl 1 Month After Going Instagram Official
summary: Darius Rucker is engaged to Emily Deahl, less than a month after they went Instagram official.
story: Darius Rucker is heading down the aisle!

The “Wagon Wheel” singer announced his engagement to girlfriend Emily Deahl in a joint Instagram post Oct. 8. The post features a photo of Rucker proposing on one knee and a selfie of Rucker kissing Deahl on the cheek.
“Thank you for showing me a level of happiness I have never known,” he wrote. “The day I met you I knew I didn’t want to go another one without you. Now I don’t have to.”

Sharing the post to her Instagram story, Deahl said she “never intended on keeping this part of my life from you guys for so long, but somewhere along the way of loving him I discovered how sacred love is to me.”
Adding that she aimed to “protect” her love with Rucker, she continued, “But damn I’m glad I don’t have to spend the time photoshopping him out of every photo now.”
Until recently, the two have kept their relationship under wraps.

Last month, the couple went Instagram official when Rucker shared a smiling selfie with Deahl outside the Sphere in Las Vegas. In the caption, Rucker said he had attended “The Wizard of Oz” experience “with my love & my boys. 1000/10!!!!!”
While she seemingly has never included Rucker in a social media post, Deahl has shared videos since April referring to “my man” and having a boyfriend.

Deahl has previously shared her music on YouTube, where she also posts lifestyle and music videos. On Spotify, she's been releasing music since 2019 and her bio describes her as being influenced by Jack White, Lady Gaga, Freddie Mercury and Elvis.

Her Spotify bio reads that she has a “love and passion for a spectacle of a performance in music,” adding that her sound “can only be described as story-telling focused pop with dark, theatrical ties.”

For Rucker, the expected nuptials will mark his second marriage after splitting from ex-wife Beth Leonard in 2020. The two share children Daniella and Jack. Rucker is also father to daughter Carolyn, whom he shares with his ex Elizabeth Ann Phillips.
In a May 2024 interview with Billboard, Rucker opened up about the impact of his 20 yearslong marriage to Leonard, saying his ex-wife “saved my life.”
“I have so much love and respect for her,” he told the outlet. “The night she just said to me, ‘It’s time to quit,’ in her very colorful way, I realized it was time to quit.”
Rucker explained the relationship ended then because he “respected her and I respected my family. I just wanted to be a better person.”
The country music star went on to take credit for the divorce, saying that he was “just, a rockstar, and I lived that life.”
"It sucks for me and in writing about her, I just wanted the world to know that it was all me," he said, referring to writing his memoir, "Life’s Too Short." "She was awesome. It was all me.”

title: EXCLUSIVE: Scott Patterson Imagines Life After 'Gilmore Girls' for Luke, Lorelai and Rory
summary: Scott Patterson talks to TODAY.com about rewatching “Gilmore Girls,” the show’s 25th anniversary and what a future revival could look like.
story: Twenty-five years ago, “Gilmore Girls” officially took the season of fall hostage.

The light-hearted dramedy followed the lives of fast-talking, coffee-obsessed and quirky mother-daughter duo Lorelai (Lauren Graham) and Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel), who lived in the cozy and close-knit town of Stars Hollow.

Created by Amy Sherman-Palladino, “Gilmore Girls” premiered on Oct. 5, 2000. The show aired for seven seasons from 2000 to 2007, first on The WB before it switched to The CW. Nine years after the series ended, the stars of the show reprised their roles for the Netflix four-part miniseries “Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life.”
Over two decades later, the show has become a pop culture phenomenon, with fans rewatching the hit show year after year, especially when days get shorter and temperatures drop.

In recent months, the nostalgia has hit a high after Graham and Bledel reunited at the 2025 Emmys. Earlier this month, a handful of actors were by Graham's side when she got her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Scott Patterson, known as Luke Danes, spoke with TODAY.com about supporting his former on-screen love interest, why he's rewatching every episode again on his iHeartRadio “I Am All In...Again! with Scott Patterson" podcast, and where he envisions Luke, Lorelai and Rory would be up to in a reunion special.
This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.
It's so awesome to celebrate the 25th anniversary of 'Gilmore Girls.' How was it reuniting with Lauren Graham and other cast members at her Walk of Fame ceremony?

It was such a fun day. What a great occasion. Much deserved for Lauren, great to be there by her side and supporting her. She's a star of that show and just did a remarkable job with that character. (I) always, always support her whenever I can.
This year is a milestone year for the show. Have you been reconnecting more with former castmates or have you always stayed in touch?

I keep in touch with as many people as possible. I do a lot of conventions so I’m always seeing Sean (Gunn) or some other cast members that do conventions. Not everybody does them.  I keep pretty plugged in.

It’s not like we’re on a “Gilmore Girls” cast group chat. But if we do a new project, we’ll get some text messages, “Hey, saw the new thing. Great. Let’s get together.” Those kinds of things. So it’s always nice and Lauren’s gathering was a chance to reconnect with some people.
Tell me about rewatching 'Gilmore Girls' for a second time on your podcast, 'I Am All In... Again!', and how you are feeling about it?

We’re on the second go-around. We just finished recapping Season 3, Episode 1, and it’s where Christopher (David Sutcliffe) and Sherry (Mädchen Amick) are pregnant. Lorelei and Christopher will not be getting together. Emily (Kelly Bishop) and Richard (Edward Herrmann) do not know and when they find out, they ridicule Lorelai and she limps into the diner trying to heal our rift because we weren’t talking. We had a big blowout.

I love this scene where she comes in and says, “Don’t see me as Lorelai. If you don’t want to talk to me, I’m Nancy or Minnie or whoever... I just need to talk.” So she sat down, talked and got emotional.

The beauty of that scene, for me, is how vulnerable she is and how clever she is to come in and say she needs to talk to me so much, she needs her friend so much that she's willing to do it under a pseudonym, which is really funny. Then just watching Luke kind of melt. His heart is reopening again.

I love the writing on this show. It’s so special that we got to do that every day. Let’s face it, it’s the cherry on top of the cake of all of our careers. We’ll never outdo this show. There will never be another “Gilmore Girls” and these characters are going to live forever. So (I’m) very lucky in that regard, I feel very, very grateful to be a part of this 25-year phenomenon. And let’s raise our glasses to 25 more years.
What is something new that you are doing this time around?

There’s a new segment I’m doing, it’s called “This Is Not Old Man Music.” We’re doing the music of the show.  I just interviewed Sister Sledge, which was an amazing interview. But we’re going to be talking about the music of the show, the musicians and stars.
We're just going to do what the fans do. We're going to keep re-watching, sharing new insights, new opinions. We're just having a blast doing it.
Would you be up for another 'Gilmore Girls' reunion?
Oh, yeah, I think they could twist my arm (laughs).
What would you picture Luke doing?

Same. I think that’s the beauty of the characters, is they don’t change. I think that’s what fans want and that’s really how it should be. I don’t think Luke has changed, he’s just gotten a little older. I don’t think Lorelai’s changed.

I don’t think, especially in Luke and Lorelai’s case, that you want to change them too much. You really don’t. I think that’s why people love them. They’re their own people. They have their own strength. They don’t need each other, but they want each other and they’re willing to span that bridge to get to one another and do all that it takes.
But she's maybe a grandma, according to the ending of 'A Year in the Life.'
Well, she is — and (maybe) she's been one for eight years, yeah. And maybe (she's) a mother, who knows? I don't know. I don't want to start rumors.

Rory's boyfriends have been a big part of the show. Jared Padalecki and Matt Czuchry did a Panera commercial together, Lauren called out Milo Ventimiglia and Jared for not being at her Walk of Fame and said, 'Points for Logan.' What team are you now?

I'm team none of them. I like them all as people. But as characters, I think Rory, once she gets her act together, and she probably has by now, she's been a mother for eight years, I think there's going to be a new energy coming into her life and a new person — and maybe she's already found someone!

So if there is a new iteration or Christmas special, maybe we meet this person. They've been together for, you know, seven years or eight years. Or maybe she's been a single mother and she meets somebody. Maybe it's a guy who just opened a diner somewhere (laughs). I'll leave the creative writing to the creative writing team.
I know there's a documentary coming out, are you involved?
Yeah, (I have) nothing to do with it. They never came to me and made a deal.

title: Zach Bryan Responds After Critics Call His Song, ‘Bad News,’ Anti-American
summary: Zach Bryan is responding to the backlash over his song "Bad News," which some listeners claim is critical of ICE and is disrespectful to the country.
story: Zach Bryan is responding to the backlash over his song "Bad News," which some listeners claim is critical of ICE.

The country music star, 29, wrote in a message Oct. 8 in his Instagram stories that those who are trying to use the song “as a weapon” are proving how “devastatingly divided” the United States has become.
Bryan shared a portion of "Bad News" on Instagram on Oct. 3, captioning his post "the fading of the red white and blue."

In the song, Bryan seemingly addresses President Donald Trump’s immigration raids, singing, "ICE is gonna come bust down your door / try to build a house no one builds no more / but I got a telephone / kids are all scared and all alone.”
The song also includes the line, "I heard the cops came /cocky motherf------, ain't they?"

While some music lovers on Reddit lauded Bryan for his lyrics, comparing him to "actual outlaw country" artists of the 1960s and '70s who routinely called out authority figures, others on X slammed the Grammy winner for being "anti-American."

Several members of the Trump administration also blasted Bryan, including White House spokeswoman Abigail Jackson, who used the titles of several of Bryan's hits in a statement accusing him of wanting to "Open The Gates to criminal illegal aliens."

Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem slammed Bryan's song as being "completely disrespectful" — "not just to law enforcement but to this country, to every single individual that has ever stood up and fought for our freedoms.”
In his response, Bryan, who served in the U.S. Navy, said he wrote "Bad News" months ago and that the song is about "how much I love the country and everyone in it more than anything.”

“When you hear the rest of the song, you will understand the full context that hits on both sides of the aisle,” he wrote. “Everyone using this now as a weapon is only proving how devastatingly divided we all are. We need to find our way back.”

"To see how much s--- it stirred up makes me not only embarrassed but kind of scared," he continued. “Left wing or right wing we’re all one bird and American. To be clear I’m on neither of these radical sides."
"To all those disappointed in me on either side of whatever you believe just know I’m trying my best too and we all say things that are misconstrued sometimes" he added.

Bryan later shared another message, writing, "I am SO proud to have served in a country where we can speak freely and converse amongst each other without getting doxed or accosted on the internet or worse; the violence and heartbreak we’ve faced in the last few months!”

title: Alan Jackson Announces 'Finale' Concert With Many A-List Guests: What to Know
summary: Alan Jackson has announced a “Last Call: One More for the Road — The Finale” concert for Nashville in 2026. Here is the date, location, special guests and ticket info.
story: Alan Jackson is going out with a bang.
The country music icon announced Oct. 8 the last full-length concert date of his touring career.
The “Chattahoochee” hitmaker will perform “Last Call: One More for the Road — The Finale” in Nashville, Tennessee, on June 27, 2026.
The news comes after Jackson told a crowd at Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee during a May stop on his “Last Call: One More for the Road Tour” that he was done touring.
“Y’all may have heard that I’m kinda winding down. In fact, this is my last road show,” Jackson told the crowd at Fiserv Forum on May 17. “Y’all are gonna make me tear up up here.”
The 16-time CMA Award winner, though, did not hide his desire to do one final show in country music’s home.
“We just felt like we had to end it all where it all started, and that’s in Nashville, Tennessee — Music City — where country music lives. I gotta do the last one there,” he said.

Jackson, 66, revealed on TODAY in 2021 that he had been diagnosed with Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease, which is a group of inherited disorders that cause nerve damage, mostly in the legs and arms, according to Mayo Clinic. CMT can cause smaller, weaker muscles, as well as a loss of sensation, muscle contractions and trouble walking.

“I have this neuropathy and neurological disease,” Jackson said then. “It’s genetic that I inherited from my daddy. ... There’s no cure for it, but it’s been affecting me for years. And it’s getting more and more obvious. And I know I’m stumbling around onstage. And now I’m having a little trouble balancing, even in front of the microphone, and so I just feel very uncomfortable.”
Learn more about Jackson's "finale" below.
When Is 'Last Call: One More for the Road — The Finale'?
The concert will be held Saturday, June 27, 2026, at Nashville’s Nissan Stadium, home of the Tennessee Titans.
Who Will Appear With Jackson at 'Last Call: One More for the Road — The Finale'?

Jackson will welcome an A-list roster of artists, including Luke Bryan, Eric Church, Luke Combs, Riley Green, Cody Johnson, Miranda Lambert, Jon Pardi, Carrie Underwood, Keith Urban and Lee Ann Womack.
How Do I Get Tickets for 'Last Call: One More for the Road — The Finale'?

Registration for presales is underway at www.AlanJacksonLastCall.com and will run through Oct. 13. Presales begin Oct. 15 at 10 a.m. CT, while tickets for the general public will become available on Oct. 17 at 10 a.m. CT. VIP options are also available.
Complete show information can be found here.
For every ticket sold to the show, $1 will be donated to the CMT Research Foundation and matched by $2 from a donor.

title: Did Ed Gein Really Talk Like That? How to Hear His Voice for Yourself After Watching 'Monster'
summary: Did Ed Gein really talk in the way he does in Monster? WHat was his voice like? Here's what to know.
story: Charlie Hunnam’s portrayal of killer Ed Gein in a new Netflix series has viewers talking, especially about the voice he chose to adopt for the chilling TV show.
“Monster: The Ed Gein Story" is a dark tale about Gein, a mid-20th century killer whose crimes inspired several horror films, including "Psycho" and "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre."

In the Netflix series, Hunnam speaks in a voice that some viewers have described as sounding like Winnie the Pooh. What motivated the actor's approach and how did Gein sound in real life? We're breaking it all down.
How Did Charlie Hunnam Invent the Ed Gein Voice in 'Monster'?
“Monster: The Ed Gein Story,” which premiered on Oct. 3, finds Hunnam using a soft voice and often speaking slowly.
In an interview with Variety, the actor described his approach, saying, "The voice needed to be really specific.”
Hunnam admitted that no one working on the TV series "really had an idea of what that was" at first, especially since audio recordings of Gein are few and far between.

Hunnam said the voice ultimately came from Gein's relationship with his mother, Augusta Gein. “I started to see him through a series of affectations to please his mother. That’s where the voice came from," he told Variety.

In an interview with Entertainment Tonight, Hunnam elaborated on his inspiration, saying he wanted to portray Gein's "soul and spirit and trauma and struggle in the way he communicates with the world."

"There's just this constant desire for acceptance and I thought that a lot of his behavior would grow inauthentically out of his desire to be the person that he thought his mother wanted him to be and that was as much like a girl as possible," the actor said.
Hunnam admitted that it took "courage" to take this approach "because I felt like this voice is going to feel inauthentic and it's not going to feel like it belongs in his body."
What Did Ed Gein's Voice Really Sound Like?
In his book “Deviant,” Schechter described Gein’s voice, writing that a hospital social worker said Gein talked "freely in a low voice, frequently with his head in his hands."
The author also noted "the softness of his voice" and "the meekness of his posture."
While describing a press interview Gein gave in a courthouse, the author said he used "a voice so quiet that the reporters in the back of the room had trouble hearing him."

As for how to hear Gein's voice for yourself? In 2023, the documentary series “Psycho: The Lost Tapes of Ed Gein” also featured recordings of Gein’s voice. The documentary is available to stream on MGM+.
How Have Viewers Responded?
After watching "Monster: The Ed Gein Story,” many viewers have expressed confusion over Hunnam's voice and wondered if Gein really spoke like that.

One YouTube user left the following comment on a video that played a recording of Gein's real voice: "Had to come check out the real voice because I knew damn well there was no way he sounded like Winnie the Pooh."
"How many other people came here after the new series of monsters came out, to see if the voice matched," another wrote.
Another left the following reaction: "He sounds so simple and innocuous. It's no wonder no one suspected what he was really capable of."
One viewer said Hunnam's voice in the show "is so different" since Gein's real voice "is much deeper."
Over on X, many social media users also weighed in on the voice, with one commenting, "I don’t know if I can get through 8 hours of Charlie Hunnam and his Ed Gein voice."
Some viewers applauded the actor for the added element of creepiness his voice lent to the role.
"Charlie hunnam’s voice for ed gein sounds like winnie the pooh but i actually dont hate it at all, it honestly makes his performance more unsettling," one wrote.
Some viewers have started to imitate Hunnam's voice in TikTok videos. One such video was captioned, "ed gein is our whole personality now."
Many X users agreed, including one who commented, "Can’t stop doing the Ed Gein voice from Monster."

title: Want to Join Jenna Bush Hager for the Chat?
summary: We are searching for "Jenna & Friends" biggest fans to join us for chat!
story: We are searching for "Jenna & Friends" biggest fans to join us for chat!

Make sure to send us a video telling us about your current obsession and why you'd be an amazing co-host with Jenna!

title: EXCLUSIVE: Melissa Joan Hart Does Not Play When It Comes To Halloween
summary: Melissa Joan Heart, who loves Halloween, shares the magical Halloween moment she arranged for her oldest son.
story: It's no surprise that Melissa Joan Heart, who portrayed the title character in "Sabrina the Teenage Witch" for seven seasons, loves Halloween. But she really loves Halloween — and as a former teenage witch, this mom of three knows how to make holidays magical.
"I've gotten in trouble once before because I take the day off," Hart tells TODAY.com. "I'm like, 'I am not working on Halloween.' As long as my kids want to trick-or-treat, I am going."

The busy mom, who is married to musician Mark Wilkerson, is raising their three sons: Mason, 19, Braydon, 16, and Tucker, 12. When Mason announced that he was going trick-or-treating last year, Hart dropped everything to join him.
"I really get into the costumes," Hart says. "I was somehow able to magically manipulate their costumes every year for many years into a family costume."
Some of her favorites were the years they went as Pinocchio, Megamind and the Three Amigos.

"We watched the ("Three Amigos") movie in May. They were all really into that movie and mimicked it all the time, so I was able to hold on to it until October," Hart says. But it wasn't an easy costume to create. "I burned my fingers hot gluing rickrack onto sombreros!"

In Hart's house, Halloween candy often takes a backseat to their favorite treat: popcorn. She recently scored a year's worth of the salty snack as the "Chief of Butter" for Pop Secret’s “Spill Everything” campaign. It encourages people to share their popcorn-worthy confessions — and hear Hart’s — via the Pop Secret Hotline.
In not-so-secret news, Hart boasts, "A few years ago, I had the greatest parenting moment. I was able to introduce my son to his hero, Jay Weinberg."

Weinberg was the drummer for the metal band Slipknot. Partly because Hart married a musician, music is a huge way she and her husband bond with the kids. So when Hart's oldest son Mason wanted to be Weinberg for Halloween, she was all-in.
"It was a process of finding the right wig, the tattoo, the uniform, sewing patches on the uniform and then getting the mask," she explains. "My friend Kelly Osborne helped me get the mask."
Yes, she means the Kelly Osborne, daughter of Sharon and Ozzy Osborne. Kelly's fiancé is Sid Wilson, another member of Slipknot.

After receiving a genuine Slipknot mask in a care package from the Osborne family, Hart posted an images of Mason's costume on social media and tagged both Osborne and Weinberg. As luck would have it, Weinberg commented, leading to a DM conversation — and since he lives near Hart in Nashville, she invited him over for dinner to surprise Mason.
It's one thing to shock your Spider-Man-loving toddler with a "real" Spider-Man, but introducing your 17-year-old son to his favorite musician is quite another.
"I got to be a hero for a day!" she says.

title: '9-1-1: Nashville' Premieres Thursday. What to Know About the Spinoff
summary: The ABC spinoff "9-1-1: Nashville" premieres Thursday, Oct. 9. Here's the time it airs, the cast, and details about the new show.
story: The “9-1-1” universe has expanded again, and this time the procedural drama is headed to Nashville.

Since the original “9-1-1” — which was created by Ryan Murphy with “Glee” collaborator Brad Falchuk and “American Horror Story” executive producer Tim Minear — debuted in 2018, the show has built a dedicated fan base eager to see how the emergency responders continue to tackle life-threatening cases. The show achieved so much success that a spinoff, “9-1-1: Lone Star,” starring Rob Lowe, arrived in 2020 and aired for five seasons before it concluded in February.

Now, a third entry in the franchise, “9-1-1: Nashville,” is set to premiere with a twist on the format. In addition to focusing on the professional lives of the first responders, the new series will also follow a “family saga of power and glamour set in one of America’s most diverse and dynamic cities,” according to the ABC show’s synopsis. The family at the center of the show is the Harts, led by Capt. Don Hart, and the series features an all-star cast.

Ahead of the premiere, Variety revealed that country music singer Kane Brown will appear in the first episode as a guest star. So, who will he be sharing the screen with? Read on to learn everything you need to know about “9-1-1,” including the cast and how to tune in to the premiere.
When Does ‘9-1-1: Nashville’ Premiere?
“9-1-1: Nashville” will arrive on ABC on Thursday, Oct. 9.
The premiere of “9-1-1: Nashville” will directly follow the return of “9-1-1” for its ninth season, also airing on Oct. 9.
What Time Does ‘9-1-1: Nashville’ Premiere?
The first episode of “9-1-1: Nashville” will air at 9 p.m. ET/PT after the Season 9 premiere of “9-1-1” ends.

ABC’s description for the “9-1-1: Nashville” pilot reads, “When a powerful tornado tears through Nashville and endangers a country music festival, Captain Don Hart leads fire station 113 on a harrowing rescue mission. Meanwhile, the Hart family contends with the fallout when a long-held secret is revealed.”
A trailer for “9-1-1: Nashville” shows Brown performing at the music festival before the natural disaster strikes and the first responders spring into action.
Who Is in the ‘9-1-1: Nashville’ Cast?

The “9-1-1: Nashville” cast is made up of famous faces that both TV and music fans will surely recognize. Leading the Hart family as Capt. Don Hart is Chris O’Donnell, who previously starred on “NCIS: Los Angeles” for 14 seasons.
Jessica Capshaw, known for playing Dr. Arizona Robbins on “Grey’s Anatomy,” will play Blythe Hart, Don’s wife.
Michael Provost, who starred on the Netflix show “Insatiable” and had a guest arc on the final season of “The Sex Lives of College Girls,” will play Blythe and Don’s son, Ryan Hart.

Hailey Kilgore is a Grammy- and Tony Award-nominated actor and singer, making her the perfect cast member for a show set in Nashville. Most recently, she was part of the “Power Book III: Raising Kanan” cast. She will portray Taylor Thompson in “9-1-1: Nashville.”

Juani Feliz’s character in “9-1-1: Nashville” is named Roxie Alba. Feliz has been all over television and movie screens during the past few years, appearing in the 2024 film “Civil War” and landing roles on shows like “Harlem,” “Fleishman Is In Trouble” and “The Equalizer.”

“9-1-1: Nashville” will be the first major role for Hunter McVey, who plays Blue Bennings, Don’s son and Ryan’s half brother. In addition to being an actor, McVey is also a podcast host, entrepreneur, influencer and model.

Rounding out the cast are two of the biggest names attached to the series: LeAnn Rimes and Kimberly Williams-Paisley. Rimes is showing off her acting skills as she enters another part of her career. She will play Dixie Bennings, the mother of McVey’s character. Meanwhile, “Father of the Bride” star Williams-Paisley is portraying a 911 dispatcher named Cammie Raleigh.

When speaking about her new role in an interview with People, Rimes said it was “so crazy” that her character on the show has a son named Blue, considering that is also the title of her 1996 debut single.
Rimes praised McVey in the interview, saying, “Oh my God, Hunter’s incredible. We had an instant connection, and he’s just the sweetest human.”
How Does the Show Connect to the ‘9-1-1’ Universe?
The trailer for “9-1-1: Nashville” says the show “expands” the 9-1-1 universe, leading to speculation that there could be a crossover between the two shows.

Oliver Stark, who portrays Buck on “9-1-1,” added to fan theories when he posted a picture of himself hanging out with the cast of “9-1-1: Nashville” on his Instagram story Oct. 6 and encouraged fans to watch the spinoff. McVey reshared the photo on his Instagram story and added, “Come back soon brotha.”
Fans will have to wait and see if Buck and other beloved “9-1-1” characters make their way to Nashville.

Like the original show, “9-1-1: Nashville” was also created by Murphy and Minear. Rashad Raisani is a creator, as well, while Falchuk joins O’Donnell and Angela Bassett, star of the flagship series, as executive producers.

title: Demi Moore Brings Back Her Iconic '90s Bangs: 'Then and Now'
summary: Demi Moore is turning back the clock, bringing back one of her most iconic looks from the ‘90s: fringe bangs.
story: Demi Moore is turning back the clock, bringing back one of her most iconic looks from the ‘90s: fringe bangs.
In an Instagram post Oct. 8, “The Substance” actor, 62, shared two photos — from “now and then” — showing off her new hairstyle.
The first shot features Moore posing with pursed lips and her signature dark brunette hair down to her waistline, with fresh bangs somewhat parted down the middle.
“Bangs — now and then,” she wrote, thanking designer brand Gucci for “letting me bring back the fringe for the first time since the Striptease days!”
The second photo showcases the actor from her 1996 hit “Striptease,” in which she sported similar long brunette hair and bangs.
Celebrity friends, family and fans alike supported the style choice in the comments, with Keke Palmer writing, “My girl,” accompanied by a heart-eyes emoji.
Moore’s daughter Tallulah Willis, whom she shares with ex Bruce Willis, wrote, “SO GOOD too good!! We love u.”
Despite the photos being captured nearly 30 years apart, fans commented on Moore’s youthful appearance in the modern-day picture, writing, “I’ll have what she’s having.”

“I thought that was her daughter,” another commented, with others specifically comparing Moore to her daughter Scout Willis, whom she also shares with Bruce Willis. The two also share a third child, daughter Rumer Willis.
While Moore has stuck with her dark locks for some time, she has ventured out in more daring transformations over the years, including a blond pixie cut and shaving her head.

In 1990, Moore debuted a short look for “Ghost,” telling People in an April interview that she was inspired at the time by Isabella Rossellini. She recalled walking into a Parisian hair salon and showing the stylist a photo of her inspiration.
While the result caused “some serious panic and serious s--- hitting the fan,” Moore told the outlet that the film crew “really did come around.”
“(My character) was an artist, a ceramicist, and all of that, and it kind of fit,” she added. “It wasn’t an intentional thing to shock them, I think I just really needed a change.”
When asked if she would return to the pixie cut, Moore told People, “I don’t ever like to say never because you never know,” adding, “but I have grown quite attached to my hair.”
Moore's short hair then turned blond, she explained, when filming “The Butcher’s Wife,” though she ultimately wore a long, light wig for the 1991 movie.
“This was a very fun time for me to have blonde hair,” Moore told the outlet. “What I realized very quickly is that dyeing your hair blonde trashes it...But it was fun while I had it.”

Filming 1997 film “G.I. Jane,” Moore shaved her head to play a Navy SEAL in training. In a September 2024 interview with Variety, Moore said she also trained in a “two-week modified SEAL training,” adding, “It was hardcore.”

title: Tour Zooey Deschanel and Jonathan Scott’s NYC Home, Including Her Kids’ Nature-Themed Room
summary: Zooey Deschanel and Jonathan Scott showed off their new New York City apartment to Architectural Digest.
story: Zooey Deschanel and Jonathan Scott aren’t so much peeling back the curtain on their new home as they are opening its doors.
The “New Girl” star and her “Property Brothers” star fiancé showed off their new New York City apartment to Architectural Digest’s “Open Door.”

The highlight of the residence may be the kids’ nature-influenced bedroom, which Scott called “probably my favorite room in the whole house.” Deschanel is mother to daughter, Elsie, 10, and son, Charlie, 8, with ex-husband Jacob Pechenik.
The room has printed mural tree wallpaper that Deschanel is “obsessed with” and multiple beds with hidden drawers and railings with hand-cut leaves on them.
“When the kids saw it for the first time, they screamed,” she said.
“I do think to myself how special it feels to wake up in a space that feels creative and this exciting. And the kids just absolutely love it,” he added.

The home also features a raised ceiling Scott and Deschanel in the entrance with an arched doorway that he calls “my favorite thing,” while he noted it’s “a tease” for what follows in the rest of the abode.
Indeed, there is plenty more: a mural that Deschanel calls “magical” and “a wonderful start to this apartment we love.” Scott said it draws people in and raises the eye line.
“This place looked absolutely nothing like the way it does now when we first looked at it,” Deschanel said, while adding her first reaction seeing the place was, “Eww, gross.”
Scott said the apartment was vacant for a long time and needed “a lot of love.”
The couple redid the kitchen, which Scott called “the heart of the home,” while Deschanel credited him for his ability to maximize space.
Deschanel pointed out the lack of recessed lighting, instead choosing chandeliers, pendants, sconces and lamps, which she describes as “magical and moody and fun.”

“This is the side effect of being engaged to someone whose father is a world-class cinematographer. The lighting is very important,” Scott said, referring to her father, Academy Award-nominated cinematographer Caleb Deschanel.
The couple also showed off their living room, complete with a hidden TV screen that drops down from ceiling.
“We love a place that feels lush and pretty, but also we want our home to feel lived in and not too stark and austere,” she said.
“We love to entertain, and, frankly, you’re the first person we’ve invited over, outside of family. We haven’t had anybody here yet, so our goal is to entertain a ton,” Scott said.

The home also features a grand piano and a karaoke setup, as well as three private terraces that he says addsa little touch of Los Angeles to the apartment. In addition, there’s a family room that Deschanel calls “cozy” that has a fireplace they added, along with custom furniture.
The master bedroom features a color scheme they both chose, along with embroidered wallpaper and a mattress made by Scott Living, the furniture company he owns with his brother Drew.
“We are so collaborative,” she said.
“She has better taste than I do,” he said. “The entire vibe in this room is peaceful.”

title: Did Ed Gein Attempt to Dig Up His Own Mother? The Truth Behind 'Monster'
summary: Did Ed Gein dig up his mother August Gein? Did he attempt to? Here's what we know.
story: The new season of "Monster" focuses on Ed Gein, a 20th century killer known for his gruesome house of horrors.
Gein, who lived in a small town in Wisconsin his entire life, admitted to killing two women. He also admitted to robbing multiple graves and adorned his house with items created from body parts.
In the Netflix show, Gein — played by actor Charlie Hunnam — attempts to dig up his mother, Augusta Gein's, grave. Augusta (Laurie Metcalf) is said to have had a strong influence on her son.

"Fanatically religious," according to the Gein biography by the true crime write Harold Schechter, Augusta Gein raised her two sons in near isolation, preaching the immorality of modern women. While Ed Gein's brother Henry attempted to pull away, Ed Gein remained devoted to his mother until her death in 1945.
Did Ed Gein Dig Up His Mother's Grave?
Earl Kileen, the district attorney of Washaura County, said in a press conference in 1957 that Ed Gein had denied robbing his mother’s grave, according to the biography “Deviant” by Harold Schechter.
But according to Scott Bowser, an Ed Gein expert who gives tours in the killer's hometown of Plainfield, Wisconsin, the killer tried — and failed — to find his mother.

“He tried, on numerous occasions, to go dig her up, but she was on a cement vault and he couldn’t get to her,” Boswer tells TODAY.com. (Bowser adds, however, the series isn't entirely accurate, focusing "heavily on gore and shock value rather than truth or history.")
According to "Deviant," Kileen said the same in the press conference: "His mother's coffin was encased in a concrete vault."
Kileen also confirmed Ed Gein robbed the grave of a woman buried in a wooden box next to his parents' burial plot.

Schechter, speaking to Rolling Stone, shares the theory that Ed Gein was attempting to retrieve his mother. “The earliest bodies (he) exhumed formed a semi-circle around his mother’s grave,” Schechter said.

As for whether Augusta Gein's influence had to do with what her son became? A 1957 summary from the chief of medical services at Wisconsin's Central State Hospital concluded that Ed Gein was "overly attached to his mother."
The report said that “it seems probable that this activity was the result of his desire to re-create the existence of his own mother.”

“After the death of his mother, he felt that he had a special power whereby he could raise the dead to life by an act of his will power; and when he found that this was not successful, his emotional needs influenced him to attempt the re-creation of his mother by using the parts of bodies from other graves,” the report said.

Ed Gein also lambasted the moral standards of the two women he killed. His comments had a "strong religious connotation," per a social service report from in 1957, and he had learned "religious training from his mother."

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Father Figure’ Lyrics Reimagine George Michael’s Classic With a Sinister Twist
summary: Taylor Swift pays homage to late music legend George Michael on “Father Figure,” the fourth song on her newly released new album, “The Life of a Showgirl.”The song not only shares a title with Michael’s 1987 hit, it also borrows a melody from the original track in its chorus, thus earning the British musician a songwriting credit alongside Swift and her collaborators, Max Martin and Shellback.
story: Taylor Swift pays homage to late music legend George Michael on “Father Figure,” the fourth song on her newly released new album, “The Life of a Showgirl.”

The song not only shares a title with Michael’s 1987 hit, it also borrows a melody from the original track in its chorus, thus earning the British musician a songwriting credit alongside Swift and her collaborators, Max Martin and Shellback.
Michael’s original song is sung from the perspective of a man who wants to be a “preacher” and “teacher” — and, notably, a “daddy” — to his younger lover.
More ‘Showgirl’ Lyrics

Revisit the highlights from the release of “The Life of a Showgirl” on TODAY.com’s live blog.
Swift sings her version from the perspective of someone in the music industry, possibly a mentor or an executive, who is allegedly taking care of his “protégé,” demanding only “loyalty” in return.

The song has a sinister tone and contains a lyric about the “love” between this person and his protégé being “pure profit.” It also contains multiple Mafia metaphors about “protecting the family,” and features the threatening lyric, “You’ll be sleeping with the fishes,” which should sound familiar to fans of “The Godfather” film franchise.
On “The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon,” Swift explained that a TV show partially inspired this song.

“I kept thinking about that scene in ‘Succession’ where Logan looks at his kids and says, ‘I love you but you are not serious people.’ I think about that scene constantly,” she said. “I think it’s one of the coolest scenes ever. I was like I want to write a song that has that energy, of Logan Roy being like, ‘You bit the hand that fed you and you do not possess the vernacular to be doing this.’”
Also, for a song themed around power dynamics — it turns out that Taylor Swift and George Michael have some similarities when it comes to their power struggles in the music industry.

Swift famously re-recorded and re-released her several of her albums as “Taylor’s Versions” after losing the rights to her master recordings when businessman Scooter Braun bought her former record label Big Machine Records and then sold her masters. She announced in May that she had bought all of her master recordings.

Like Swift, Michael also battled his record company, Sony Music, unsuccessfully suing the company in 1992 over his contract and claiming the company regarded him as “no more than a piece of software,” according to the BBC.

During an appearance on BBC1, Swift also spoke about the connection (or lack thereof) between her song “Father Figure” and the 2024 movie “Babygirl” starring Nicole Kidman and Harris Dickinson, which features “Father Figure” prominently.

“It was actually written before then,” Swift said of her song. “I thought it was a fun coincidence. It’s a very different way of using a father figure to talk about power and power structures and the flipping of the power dynamics.”

title: 'Dancing With the Stars' Announces a Live Tour: How to Get Tickets
summary: "Dancing With the Stars" announced its pro dancers will be hitting the road next year for its 2026 live tour. Find tour dates for your city and learn how to get tickets.
story: "Dancing With the Stars" is bringing the ballroom to a city near you.

The dance competition show announced its pro dancers will be hitting the road next year for the "Dancing With the Stars Live" tour, beginning in January in Akron, Ohio, and wrapping up in May in Salt Lake City.

Pro dancers like Emma Slater, Val Chmerkovskiy, Britt Stewart, Ala Bernsten, Brandon Armstrong, Jenna Johnson, Daniella Karagach, Pasha Pashkov, Ezra Sosa and Hailey Bills are set to perform on the tour, according to the tour's website.
The tour announcement was made during the Oct. 7 episode, where the stars and pro dancers performed to songs from Disney classics in honor of the night’s theme, Disney Night.
Hilaria Baldwin and her partner Gleb Savchenko were eliminated at the end of the episode, and Baldwin thanked her family for their support while she was on the show.
“This has been an incredible experience,” Baldwin said. “I’m so grateful to all of you.”

Tickets for the "Dancing With the Stars" tour go on sale on Friday, Oct. 10 at 10 a.m. Fans who signed up for the Mirrorball Membership also had access to a presale tickets at 10 a.m. on Wednesday, Oct. 8.
Keep reading for a full list of tour dates.

title: What Time Is Taylor Swift on 'Late Night with Seth Meyers'? How to Tune In
summary: Taylor Swift is set to appear on 'Late Night With Seth Meyers' to discuss 'The Life of a Showgirl.' Here's when to watch and how to stream the interview.
story: Taylor Swift is continuing her "Life of a Showgirl" press tour.
The "Fate of Ophelia" singer will appear on "Late Night with Seth Meyers" tonight to talk about her new album causing chatter in the Swiftie universe and beyond.
The pop star has appeared on a number of TV shows and radio stations since she released "Life of a Showgirl" on Oct. 3.
She recently visited "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon" on its Oct. 6 episode to promote her new album, noting how happy she was that the album is finally out.

"This has just been, I think the most well-matched era in terms of where my life was when I wrote it and where I am now when it's out in the world," she told host Jimmy Fallon. "I feel the exact same way as I did when I wrote and recorded these songs."
The "Midnights" singer is expected to drop more gems about "Life of a Showgirl" during her appearance on "Late Night with Seth Meyers."
Scroll below to see how you can watch her upcoming appearance on the NBC late-night talk show.
What time will Taylor Swift be on 'Late Night with Seth Meyers'?
Swift’s episode of “Late Night with Seth Meyers” will air at 12:35 a.m. ET on Oct. 9.
How to watch Taylor Swift on ‘Late Night with Seth Meyers’
"Late Night with Seth Meyers" will air live on NBC, and the show will also be available to stream the next day on Peacock.
(NBC and Peacock are owned by TODAY.com’s parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: Watch Bad Bunny Get Foul Ball at Yankees Game
summary: Bad Bunny nabbed a foul ball during Game 3 of the New York Yankees-Toronto Blue Jays ALDS playoff game at Yankee Stadium.
story: Bad Bunny has become Mr. October.

A two-week stretch in which he was announced as this season's Super Bowl halftime performer and hosted the Season 51 premiere of "Saturday Night Live" had another highlight moment on Oct. 7 when he nabbed a foul ball at Yankee Stadium during the New York Yankees' playoff game against the visiting Toronto Blue Jays.

The international superstar was sitting two rows behind home plate during the Yankees' eventual 9-6 comeback win over the Blue Jays in the American League Division Series when he grabbed a souvenir after it nearly plunked him in the head.

Toronto outfielder Anthony Santander popped up a foul ball straight behind home plate in the third inning. Video shared by Major League Baseball showed Bad Bunny initially covering his head to avoid the ball bonking him on the skull before recovering to pick up the loose baseball.
He then held it up for the cameras with a smile as fans enjoyed the moment.
"Even the baseballs wanna collab with him now," one fan joked on X.
"Is he just everywhere?" another wrote.
The Yankees are hoping that it's good luck, as the victory kept their season alive for another game. They trail the Blue Jays 2-1 in the best-of-five series.

The Puerto Rican superstar wasn't the only memorable fan to catch a baseball in the stands at a playoff game on Oct. 7. A Seattle Mariners fan wearing a shirt that said "Dump 61 Here"  serendipitously came up with a home run ball in Seattle's playoff win over the Detroit Tigers.

The shirt was referring to the nickname "Big Dumper" for Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh, who hit a team-record 60 home runs in the regular season. Raleigh hit his 61st home run overall and first of the playoffs into the bullpen in left field at Detroit's Comerica Park, and it bounced right to fan Jameson Turner in his custom shirt.
Turner then took off his shirt to reveal an updated shirt that said "Dump 62 Here."

Raleigh didn't deposit No. 62 into the seats in the game, but he did help the Mariners take a 2-1 lead in the best-of-five series. The Mariners-Tigers winner will face the winner of the Yankees-Blue Jays series in the American League Championship Series.

title: 'Love Is Blind' Star Addresses Backlash to Conversation About LGBTQ+ Kids
summary: "Love Is Blind" star Nick Amato responded to backlash about his comments to LGBTQ+ kids.
story: "Love Is Blind" viewers had a lot to say about Nick Amato and Annie Lancaster's conversation about LGBTQ+ children.
The two singles, who later went on to get engaged, discussed the topic of parenting a child who belongs to the LGBTQ+ community in Episode 4 of Season 9 of the dating show.
Now, Nick is responding to viewers who weren't pleased with how the conversation went. Below, we're outlining everything you need to know about the controversy and his response.
What Did Nick and Annie Say in the Dating Pods?
While getting to know each other in the "Love Is Blind" pods, Nick and Annie started talking about their desire to have children one day.
Nick then posed the following question to Annie: "How would you react if at some point your child told you they were LGBTQ+?"
"No matter what, I'm always going to love my kids. But I can't tell you I would be the first person to be like, 'Yay!' You know what I mean?" Annie responded.
"I do know exactly what you mean," Nick said.

Annie went on to explain her response, saying, "I'll support my kids, but (would be) making sure that they're informed. Like, 'Do you know what you're doing? Do you know what you're getting into? Do you know what you're signing up for?" she said.
Nick then asked Annie if she thinks certain subsets of the LGBTQ+ community are "a fad."
"100%," she said.
Nick then explained why he would be concerned if his child's friend suggested they might be a member of the LGBTQ+ community.
"When kids start having those thoughts too young — and maybe I am old fashioned — but it's like a concern for me because who's telling you that?" he said.

Nick went on to recall a time in high school where he was "depressed." Concerned about his well-being, his mother was curious if something bigger was going on and asked if her son was gay. He said no.
The conversation elicited a strong response from viewers.

"Nick and Annie’s conversation about potential children identifying as LGBTQIA is sickening beyond belief and a tragic reminder of what our youth are facing. People deserve more than this," one X user commented.

Another penned the following reaction: "Watching love is blind and genuinely shocked that netflix included the conversation between Annie and Nick talking about if they would be okay having lgbtq+ kids."
One social media user also commented, "I’ll be fast forwarding through all of Annie and Nick scenes after that gross homophobic conversation."
What Did Nick Say About the Backlash?
Nick took to Instagram to share a response to viewer backlash. In a video message, Nick said the "gay kids and gay love conversation" had been "deeply impacting me over the last couple of days."
“I appreciate you giving me all the hell that you did and saying, ‘That’s not right.’ Yes, it was cut up and edited, but I need to take accountability too,” he said.
Nick admitted "there's a lot that I didn't understand."

The Season 9 star also clarified the use of the term "fad" in his conversation with Annie, saying they were referring to "over-introducing sexual content material to kids' shows at a young age or the idea of gay identity."
Nick said he would "love my kids regardless" of their sexual identity and brought up the example of his mother questioning him if he was gay in high school.

"I laughed it off and you know, I said, 'Oh no, there's no way!' But why would I have had to defend myself for that? You know, it doesn't make any sense because being gay is perfectly normal but I wasn't normalized to that," he said.
Nick ended his video by saying he wanted to use his platform to inform others and not spread hate.

“There’s so much hate in this world. If I can’t use this platform to help introduce people who used to think like I did to some of these new ideas ... if I can’t use that platform for good then it’s a platform wasted.”

In the caption, he wrote, "I take full accountability for how my words came across but I am glad it provoked this discussion and my learning. I was born in a traditional Midwestern environment, and I now recognize how that shaped certain blind spots (I’m thankful for the support of my friends recently for helping me learn this)."

title: Dolly Parton's Sister Freida Clarifies Comments on Country Singer's Health: 'I Didn't Mean to Scare Anyone'
summary: Dolly Parton's sister Freida Parton has clarified her comments after she asked for prayers regarding the country star's health.
story: Dolly Parton's sister has clarified her comments after she asked for prayers regarding the country star's health.
Freida Parton, a younger sister of the singer, said she wanted to "clear something up" in a Facebook post on Oct. 7.

"I didn’t mean to scare anyone or make it sound so serious when asking for prayers for Dolly," she said. "She’s been a little under the weather, and I simply asked for prayers because I believe so strongly in the power of prayer. It was nothing more than a little sister asking for prayers for her big sister."
She thanked her followers for lifting her sister up, adding, "Your love truly makes a difference."
Representatives for Dolly Parton did not immediately respond to a request for comment from NBC News.
Freida Parton's comments come less than 12 hours after she asked her followers in a separate Facebook post to pray for her older sister because she said Dolly Parton wasn't feeling well.

"Last night, I was up all night praying for my sister, Dolly. Many of you know she hasn’t been feeling her best lately. I truly believe in the power of prayer, and I have been lead to ask all of the world that loves her to be prayer warriors and pray with me," she wrote.
"She’s strong, she’s loved, and with all the prayers being lifted for her, I know in my heart she’s going to be just fine," she continued. "Godspeed, my sissy Dolly. We all love you!"
Last month, Dolly Parton announced she would be postponing her upcoming performances in Las Vegas due to "health challenges."
The country icon said in a Sept. 28 statement posted on Instagram her doctors told her she would need to have "a few procedures," without specifying what kind.

“As I joked with them, it must be time for my 100,000-mile check-up, although it’s not the usual trip to see my plastic surgeon!” she wrote. "In all seriousness, given this, I am not going to be able to rehearse and put together the show that I want you to see, and the show that you deserve to see. You pay good money to see me perform, and I want to be at my best for you."
Dolly Parton added she will be able to work on the rest of her projects from her home in Nashville, Tennessee, and that she just needs more time to "get show ready."

"And don't worry about me quittin' the business because God hasn't said anything about stopping yet," she said. "But, I believe He is telling me to slow down right now so I can be ready for more big adventures with all of you."
She thanked her followers for understanding and said she loved them. Her performances in Las Vegas were originally scheduled for December and have been rescheduled for September 2026.

title: 'Wicked: For Good' Tickets Are Now on Sale. Here's How to Get Them
summary: 'Wicked: For Good' tickets go on sale online today following the new trailer reveal. Learn how to purchase your tickets and secure your seats for the film.
story: "Wicked: For Good" tickets are finally on sale!
The news was announced on Oct. 8 in a trailer on the film's official social media accounts.

The clip teased moments from the upcoming movie including what appeared to be Glinda's wedding and her reunion with Elphaba. There is also a moment in the trailer where Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo sing a snippet of “For Good.”
"Get tickets now. Witness the epic conclusion," the words displayed on clip read.

To celebrate the tickets being on sale, Universal Pictures will be releasing an all-new piece that highlights some songs that will be in the film. The piece also offers a first listen for two new songs — "Girl in the Bubble" and "No Place Like Home" — which will be in the film.

Tickets are now available for all types of screenings, including  Amazon Prime member early screenings on Nov. 17, early access screenings in premium formats on Nov. 19 and double features on Nov. 20.

"Wicked: For Good" is based on the popular Broadway musical, which follows the success of 2024’s “Wicked.” On Sept. 24, Universal Pictures released the final trailer “Wicked: For Good," which showed some exciting moments from the forthcoming film.

In the final trailer, Elphaba was seen flying in the air and carving out the words, “Our wizard lies,” in the clouds, as Glinda watched from below. There was also a never-before-seen moment where Elphaba confronted Glinda and told her she has “no real power.”
Thanks to her role as Elphaba, Erivo earned an Academy Award nomination earlier this year for best actress in a leading role, and Grande got nominated for best supporting actress.
“Wicked: For Good” is expected to hit theaters on Nov. 21.

title: Trump says 'first phase' of Gaza peace plan has been signed
summary: President Donald Trump posted on Truth Social on Wednesday that the "first phase" of the peace plan to end the war in Gaza had been signed."I am very proud to announce that Israel and Hamas have both signed off on the first Phase of our Peace Plan.
story: President Donald Trump posted on Truth Social on Wednesday that Israel and Hamas had agreed to the “first phase” of the peace plan to end the war in Gaza.

"I am very proud to announce that Israel and Hamas have both signed off on the first Phase of our Peace Plan. This means that ALL of the Hostages will be released very soon, and Israel will withdraw their Troops to an agreed upon line as the first steps toward a Strong, Durable, and Everlasting Peace," Trump wrote. "All Parties will be treated fairly! This is a GREAT Day for the Arab and Muslim World, Israel, all surrounding Nations, and the United States of America, and we thank the mediators from Qatar, Egypt, and Turkey, who worked with us to make this Historic and Unprecedented Event happen. BLESSED ARE THE PEACEMAKERS!"
Hamas also confirmed reaching an agreement on the peace plan in a statement on Wednesday.

"After responsible and serious negotiations between the movement and the Palestinian resistance factions regarding President Trump’s proposal in Sharm el-Sheikh, with the goal of reaching an end to the war of extermination against our Palestinian people and the occupation’s withdrawal from the Gaza Strip, the Islamic Resistance Movement (Hamas) announces the conclusion of an agreement stipulating an end to the war on Gaza, the occupation’s withdrawal from it, the entry of aid, and a prisoner exchange," the statement said.

Hamas asked "President Trump, the guarantor states of the agreement, and various Arab, Islamic, and international parties to compel the [Israeli] government to fully implement the agreement’s requirements" in the statement.
Israeli Prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu also acknowledged that an agreement had been reached in a post on X on Wednesday.
"A great day for Israel. Tomorrow I will convene the government to approve the agreement and bring all our dear hostages home," he wrote.
Netanyahu added, "I thank from the depths of my heart President Trump and his team for their mobilization for this sacred mission of releasing our hostages."
U.N. Secretary-General António Guterres expressed support for the agreement in a statement.

“The United Nations will support the full implementation of the agreement and will scale up the delivery of sustained and principled humanitarian relief, and we will advance recovery and reconstruction efforts in Gaza,” the statement said.
Guterres added, "The stakes have never been higher."
Trump had said earlier that he may travel to the Middle East at the end of the week but did not specifically say he would be going to Egypt, where peace talks are being held.
"I may go there sometime toward the end of the week, maybe on Sunday, actually," Trump told reporters at the White House.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio passed a note to Trump at the White House gathering with reporters and walked over to speak to him.

title: U.K.'s public health service is in crisis, threatening a British institution
summary: “Nye,” an unlikely hit about the creator, and origin story, of Britain’s taxpayer-funded National Health Service, came at an inflection point for the NHS.
story: LONDON — Despite being headlined by a genuine star and staged at one of London’s premier theaters, a play about the foundation of a sprawling and troubled public service seemed unlikely to provoke night after night of standing ovations.
But that’s what happened with “Nye,” an unlikely hit about the creator, and origin story, of Britain’s taxpayer-funded National Health Service.

The play, written by Tim Price and directed by Rufus Norris, came at an inflection point for the NHS, as it’s known. Almost 80 years after it was founded, the medical service once touted as the envy of the world is “broken” and suffering the “biggest crisis in its history,” the government says. The crisis at this national bedrock is part of a bigger malaise at the heart of British culture: rising prices, stagnant wages and crumbling public services.

“I’m terrified, not just for the NHS, but for the whole of our society,” Michael Sheen, who starred as Aneurin “Nye” Bevan, the founder of the NHS, told NBC News in an interview. “Once it’s torn down, then I guess people will think about what they’ve lost.”

Sheen, 56, better known to international audiences as Tony Blair in “The Queen,” David Frost in “Frost/Nixon” and the angel Aziraphale in the Amazon Prime series “Good Omens,” has spent much of the last two years honing his portrayal of Bevan, the socialist politician who dragged himself out of Wales’ coal mines to will the NHS into existence.

Though second nature to Brits, the ideal of the NHS is unfamiliar to many Americans: British people have universally free health care at the point of access — from ambulances attending car accidents to insulin for diabetes to cancer care to childbirth. Though some people do have private insurance, the idea of having to choose between illness and financial ruin is shocking in the U.K.

Now, the Labour Party, which created the then-radical NHS in 1948, is battling its own economic constraints and record-setting unpopularity. It has a colossal task if it is to fix the crumbling hospitals replete with overworked doctors and bed-lined corridors.
